About

The Chicago Linguistic Society is the oldest student-run linguistics organization in the United States. Our linguistics conference has been held every year since 1965. This academic year, CLS will host its 53rd annual meeting, which will be held from Thursday, May 25, to Saturday, May 27, 2017.

Invited Speakers

  • Lucas Champollion
  • Itamar Francez
  • Thomas Graf
  • Sun-Ah Jun
  • Audrey Li
  • Josep Quer

On this site, you can find information about CLS 53, view the call for papers, view the conference schedule and booklet, find information about conference proceedings, and learn about past conferences. An announcement about CLS 53 conveying a proper subset of this information is also available on LinguistList and can be accessed here.
